page.title: 10INGOLDSBY FIELDS
page.content: The fields on the edge of Ingoldsby are thought to be strip farmed. This technique was used in Medieval times. One farmer divided his land between his sons and each strip became narrower. We can see four or five of these fields on the edges of both Ingoldsby and Lenton. Each of these fields is about the same size and has approximately 20 ridges. We have found out that the farmers used to rope one or two oxen to a primitive plough made of wood metal and hide. They turned over the soil ready for sowing. When they were ready to sow they took a big bag of seed and threw the seed around. When the harvest was ready they cut it with a scythe and stacked it up to dry. When it was dry they threshed it by hand.
